200.heading: Specialties.
200.title: Best of Scarlett.
200.author: [No author]
notes: "Collecting the most heroic moments of G.I. Joe, this volume focuses on red-headed wild-card Scarlett. As lethal as she is beautiful, Scarlett is a force to be reckoned with. Skilled with a large selection of standard weapons, her preferred piece of hardware is a crossbow. Romantically linked to enigmatic Joe team member Snake Eyes, similarly mysterious is Scarlett's secondary specialty, which remains classified. Read all about her valiant actions in classic G.I. Joe: a real American hero issues #6, 9, 10, 21, 27 and Yearbook #3."

210.title: "Another Colonial Tale" p. 32-38 in Outer States
210.author: Enki Bilal (New York : Catalan Communications, 1990).
notes: Summary: A blue alien woman rescues a robot from quicksand. The solitary human colonist wants to try interbreeding with her species, but the robot gets jealous and kills him. Then a blue alien man shows up, and the robot kills itself, much to the puzzlement of the alien couple.

214.heading: Species.
214.title: Dominant Species
214.author: story, Chuck Austen ; art, Kia Asamiya ; colors, J
notes: "Originally published in magazine form as Uncanny X-Men #416-420."

Summary (from SkyRiver): As the X-Men adjust to an influx of new students and the recent arrival at the Institute of their former enemy, Juggernaut, a squad of X-Men is called to investigate a murder and, in the process, they uncover a plot to exterminate homo sapiens in favor of mutants.

notes: Begins: "In the underworld, there are two ways of getting rid of a rat. If he's dangerous, they chill him. If he's a coward like Vic Reno, he's just stepped on and sent on his way. On the evening of October 17th 1943, in a large midwestern city, Vic Reno was receiving the coward's treatment!"
